p.value: Identification of item, date; George Washington Polk Papers; TAM 178; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by William Polk in 1994. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1995.030 and 2018.026.

George Polk (1913-1948) was an American journalist for CBS who disappeared in Greece and was found dead a few days later on Sunday May 16, 1948, shot at point-blank range in the back of the head, and with hands and feet tied. Polk was covering the civil war in Greece between the right wing government and communists and had been critical of both sides. He alleged that a few officials in the Greek government had embezzled up to $250,000 in aid (or $2.2 million in 2007 dollars) from the Truman Administration, a charge that was never proved.

This collection contains: I. GWP writings - broadcasts and cables, diaries, notebooks, short stories, Middle East Mosaic (book ts.); II. Clippings, cables re GWP murder, clips collected by GWP; III. Family Correspondence, incl. WRP (William Roe Polk - brother), ARP (Adelaide Roe Polk - mother); IV. GWP memorabilia, awards, memorials; V. Photographs - GWP, WRP, other family.
